text: Harshvardhan Joshi (born 13 November 1995) is an Indian mountaineer from Vasai, Maharashtra. He has climbed six mountains of 6000 meters and above in his mountaineering career which started in 2016. ==Early life== Joshi was born in Vasai, Maharashtra. He graduated with a Bachelor of Engineering degree in IT from Mumbai University He was schooled in his native village, and after his secondary education, he earned his Bachelor's degree in Information technology from Mumbai University. ==Mountaineering Expeditions== Harshvardhan climbed Stok Kangri (20,187 ft) in 2016 unsupported becoming the youngest Indian to climb it solo then. On 4 October 2019, Joshi embarked on an expedition to Nepal. He was the only Indian on the expedition to Himlung Himal (7126m peak), an unexplored mountain in the remote Nar-Phu region of Nepal Harshvardhan had been training himself for the last four years to attempt Mount Everest in 2020. That expedition was cancelled due to the COVID-19 pandemic. ==Training== * Advanced Mountaineering Course (Himalayan Mountaineering Institute, Darjeeling) * Method of Instruction (Jawahar Institute of Mountaineering and Winter Sport, Jammu & Kashmir) * Wilderness First Responder (Wilderness Medicine Institute NOLS). * Advanced Skiing Course (Indian Institute of Skiing & Mountaineering, Jammu & Kashmir) * Search & Rescue Course (Nehru Institute of Mountaineering, Uttarakhand). ==References== ==External links== * Category:Indian mountain climbers Category:1995 births Category:University of Mumbai alumni Category:Living people
